definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: When I finally came out of prison I was 33 years old.
sentences.chinese: 當我終於出獄的時候，已經33歲了。

sentences.english: After released from prison, he was determined to turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 出獄後，他決心洗心革面，重新做人。

sentences.english: They were bailed out by Banksy, the British artist, in February.
sentences.chinese: 今年2月他倆由英國的藝術家Banksy保釋出獄。

sentences.english: This is a new project to help ex-prisoners turn over a new leaf.
sentences.chinese: 這是一項皆在幫助出獄的犯人重新做人的新計劃。

sentences.english: When I am free, I will take up my cross. I will crucify the pride in me.
sentences.chinese: 等出獄後，我要負起十字架，釘死我的驕傲。

sentences.english: I was liberated four days ago, and am on my way to Pontarlier, which is my destination.
sentences.chinese: 出獄四天了，現在我要去蓬塔利埃，那是我的目的地。

sentences.english: Several years after the valley of families out of jail, wait at the gate of the valley of household is rich.
sentences.chinese: 數年後戶谷出獄，在門口等候戶谷的人是豐美。

sentences.english: I was liberated four days ago, and am on my way to Pontarlier.
sentences.chinese: 出獄四天了，現在我要去蓬塔利埃。

sentences.english: After his release from prison, John vowed to live down his crimes.
sentences.chinese: 約翰出獄後立誓要悔過自新，使人們原諒他的罪行。

sentences.english: In order to repay in two flat out of jail head will secret before old told him.
sentences.chinese: 爲了回報在二平出獄前老孫頭將機密通知了他。

sentences.english: After be released from prison, turn and careerism, aspire stand out.
sentences.chinese: 出獄後，轉而追求名利，立志出人頭地。

sentences.english: In 1990, after 27 years in prison, Nelson Rolihlahla Mandela was finally released.
sentences.chinese: 1990年，過了27年牢獄生活的曼德拉出獄了。

sentences.english: I also did what needed to be done to prepare for Hanna`s release.
sentences.chinese: 我也爲漢娜的出獄做了些必要的安排。

sentences.english: After the husband leaves prison loves another, makes her to die by heartbreak.
sentences.chinese: 丈夫出獄後移情別戀，令她傷心欲絕。

sentences.english: His wife will keep him straight when he is released from prison.
sentences.chinese: 他出獄後，他的妻子將幫助他悔過自新。

sentences.english: This is the other thone of the novel when Doctor Manette was released from prison.
sentences.chinese: 這是其他電話的小說時，曼內特醫生出獄。

definition: to go to jail/to be sent to prison
an execution/to put sb to death
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
to expel (a member of an organization)/to fire (an employee)
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to be determined to/to insist on
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
to vanish without trace (idiom)/to lie low
